org.openadaptor.auxil.expression
Class RegularExpression

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.auxil.expression.Expression
      org.openadaptor.auxil.expression.RegularExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
IExpression
public class RegularExpression
extends Expression
implements IExpression

This class builds upon the Expression class by allowing regular expressions with substitution groups to be applied to the value generated by the Expression class. Use this class when Expression allows you to select a superset of the data that you want, but you need to select a subset of the data or to change it in some way. For example the following is extracting a date string from within a value:

getValue

public java.lang.String getValue()
The new value to set the attribute to. This can be a substitution group.

Returns:
the new value that the attribute is to be set to.

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.String value)
Required: the new value to set the attribute to.

Note that this may make use of capture groups in the match, so it is not a literal expression.

Parameters:
value - the new value that the attribute is to be set to.

public java.lang.String getMatch()
The regular expression pattern to match.

setMatch

public void setMatch(java.lang.String match)
Required: the regular expression pattern to match.

This is not a literal expression (regular expression pattern matching rules will be applied).

Parameters:
match -

isModifyMatches

public boolean isModifyMatches()
Controls the behaviour of the optional match property.

Returns:
whether the optional conditional matching should have normal (or inverted) logic applied.

setModifyMatches

public void setModifyMatches(boolean modifyMatches)
Optional: controls whether we try to modify attributes that match or do not match the value specified in the match property.

By default it is true which means modify if attribute value matches. By setting it to false you invert the logic (so it modifies all except those that match).

Parameters:
modifyMatches -

isReplaceAll

public boolean isReplaceAll()
Whether all occurrences of match in the attribute value are to be replaced by value.

Returns:
true if all occurrences are to be replaced; false if just the first one is to be replaced.

setReplaceAll

public void setReplaceAll(boolean replaceAll)
Optional: controls whether first or all matches in an attribute value are replaced (defaults to false and so just replaces first occurrence).

It is more computationally efficient to default to just matching the first one. So that is the default chosen, and it should be overridden whenever multiple replacement is required.

Parameters:
replaceAll -

validate

public java.lang.Exception[] validate()
TODO: validate() is not currently called on Expression instances, but I think it should be.

Returns:
array of Exceptions explaining why it fails to validate.

evaluate

public java.lang.Object evaluate(ISimpleRecord record)
                          throws RecordException
Description copied from interface: IExpression
Evaluate the expression using the supplied record (an ISimpleRecord) to supply variable values.

Note that if the expression itself is null, then this should return null.
If the supplied record is null then an ExpressionException may be thrown, but only if the expression contains any attribute references (as they cannot be resolved).

Specified by:
evaluate in interface IExpression
Overrides:
evaluate in class Expression
Returns:
Object containing the result of the expression.
Throws:
RecordException
